item.title: Prepare for CELPIP Test
item.description: A Necessary Condition of Post Graduate Work Permit (PGWP) and Immigration in Canada In the last year, IRCC implemented the policy that to get PGWP, a graduated student must obtain English test at level of CLB 7 or higher.

item.title: Open a Start-Up
item.description: Start a Start-Up Last year, I started my own business Hemlig AI and fortunately, we successfully got some investors who have interest in our products. Apart from that, we also sell our plans to preserve privacy and earn some money in 2024.

item.title: Build Your Own GPU Workstation
item.description: As machine learning researchers, sometimes we may have the need to have our own GPU workstation. Along with the recent trend of WuKong, I built a 4090 GPU workstation. The total amount excluding the price of GPU is around 1800 before tax.

item.title: Write High-quality Code
item.description: Some Experience to Share For Writing Good Code During my experience of researching and doing projects, I believe it is always very helpful to manage good code. Clear code with good annotations will help us complete projects and develop products more smoothly.

item.title: Prepare Your Application for CS PhD.
item.description: Catalog Catalog Before You Read Let’s Start Introduction Before Application What do I mean by managing research? Why do you need papers? The Application Connection Reference Letter Research Experience Publications Choosing programs and professors CV Meeting Slides Personal History Statement SOP/PS/RP Writing a PS Paragraph 1 Paragraph 2-4 Last two paragraphs GPA Research Internship TOFEL/GRE Connecting Professors via Email After Application Contact Me Previous students advised Before You Read This will be a long article which will take you approximately about 15 minutes to read.
I believe having a good code repo is a necessary part of a good paper. You can find the source code for my papers and other interesting projects through my Github.

item.title: Publications
item.description: You can learn more about my papers through Google Scholar and OpenReview. Privacy-Preserving Techniques for Machine Learning Topics of Privacy for Foundation Models Dixi Yao, Tian Li. “Differentially Private Retrieval Augmented Generation with Random Projection” in ICLR 2025 Workshop Building Trust in LLMs and LLM Applications: From Guardrails to Explainability to Regulation, Singapore, Apr 27 - Apr 28, 2025.
